org.dataconservancy.dcs.util

Class FilePathUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dataconservancy.dcs.util.FilePathUtil

extends Object
    Utility class for handling File Path creation and editing

        public FilePathUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • prependFileUriPrefix

        public static String prependFileUriPrefix(String filePath)
        Takes a file path string and prepends the correct file URI prefix.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The file path to prepend the correct file URI prefix to.
        Returns:
        The file path with the file uri prefix prepended, or null if the file path is null.

      • getFileExtension

        public static String getFileExtension(String filePath)
        Takes a file path and returns the extension of the file, or an empty string if the file is a directory. If the file has two extensions (i.e. .tar.gz) both will be returned.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The file path pointing to the file to return the extension for.
        Returns:
        The extension of the file pointed to by the provided file path including the preceding '.', or null if the provided file path is null.

      • getLastFileExtension

        public static String getLastFileExtension(String filePath)
        Get the last file extension from a file. If the file has multiple extensions (i.e. .tar.gz) on the last (.gz) will be returned. If the string provided has no extensions an empty string will be returned.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The file path to get the last extension for.
        Returns:
        The last extension of the file pointed to by the provided file path including the preceding '.', or null if the provided file path is null.

      • removeFileExtension

        public static String removeFileExtension(String filePath)
        Takes a file path, or file name and removes the extension from the file. If the file has two extensions (i.e. .tar.gz) both will be removed.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The file path pointing to the file to remove the extension from.
        Returns:
        The original file path with the extension removed, or null if the orignal file path was null.

      • removeLastFileExtension

        public static String removeLastFileExtension(String filePath)
        Removes just the last extension from a file. If the file has multiple extensions (i.e. .tar.gz) on the first (.gz) will be removed. If the string passed in contains no extensions it will be returned unchanged.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The file path pointing to the file to remove the extension from.
        Returns:
        The original file path with th extension removed, or null if the original file path was null.

      • convertToClasspathUrl

        public static String convertToClasspathUrl(String filePath,
                                           String classpathBase)
        Transforms the file path into a classpath resource urls.

        If the filePath starts with a forward slash or if it starts with 'file:/' URL, the text up to the first occurrence of classpathBase is stripped. The text "classpath:" is prefixed to filePath, and returned. If filePath already starts with "classpath:", then no transformation occurs.

        Parameters:
        filePath - the file path string
        classpathBase - the classpath base to preserve
        Returns:
        the transformed source string, or null if the file path is null.

      • hasValidFilePath

        public static boolean hasValidFilePath(File file)
        This method checks whether a file path contains any illegal characters.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to check
        Returns:
        boolean true if the path is OK, false otherwise

      • getInvalidFilnameErrorString

        public static String getInvalidFilnameErrorString(File file)
        This method provides an error string for illegal characters in file names
        Parameters:
        file - the file with the bad path
        Returns:
        a String to be used in constructing an error message

      • getCharacterBlackList

        public static String getCharacterBlackList()
        This method provides a String containing invalid characters for path elements. The bagit specification wants us to avoid these for Windows file names: section 7.2.2
        Returns:
        a string containing the illegal characters

      • sanitizePath

        public static String sanitizePath(String path)
        Takes a string path and removes bagit specification blacklisted characters from it, note that path characters are ignored.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to remove blacklisted characters from
        Returns:
        The sanitized path string with no invalid characters
